Title: Microbes Redefined Personality
Author: ভিসেন্ত সি. জোশি
Summary:
The book "Microbes-Redefined Personality" is intended primarily as a text book of science teachers and students of biological sciences, interested in microbes and microbiology. It presents information that is mandatory in the modern aspects of biological development, economic of microorganisms, and environmental implications. The content has been prepared as a resource material for students, researchers in the field of microbiology and others concerned with science education in general.

Contents : 
Preface
Microbes as Life Forms
Bacteria: Let Us Look at them
Microbes and Antibioctics
Microbes in their Habitat
Living with Microbes
Probiotics
Invisible Villains
Microbes and Food
Microbes and You 
Microbes and Biological Technology
Microbes and Biological Warfare
Microbes and Alternative Energy
Microbes in Brief-Summary

Title: Adult Education and Extension
Author: জেথিথোর
Summary:
In consonance with its need that the University Extension Work ( UEW) represents the Third Dimension of Higher Education, the UGC in steps since 1988-89 to link the career advancement and promotions of the University of College Teachers with their participation in the comprehensive programme of the UEW drawn according to the Area Development Approach (ADA). Introduced on an experimental basis for a period of five years, the elements of Extension Work as the Adult Education, mass Programme of Functional Literacy, Vocation-based Continuing Education and Population Education. The Scheme was introduced in several Universities in India, during 1989-90.

Notwithstanding the lofty aim to combine the pursuit of higher learning with the socially desired community work to broaden the vision of the teachers and students, the scheme has evoked intense debate because of its linkage with the career advancement, promotion and consequently with higher pay scale. Thus, the questions have been raised as to the desirability of foisting the scheme on unwilling elements in the teaching faculty and students about the efficacy of the role of functionaries, the adequacy of the Orientation Programmes conducted for the functionaries, the extent to which the Teachers, functionaries and Beneficiaries are motivated to participate in the extension work, the difficulties which they encounter in the process and above, whether the scheme attaches greater premium to promotion of social commitment vis-??-vis professional competence.

The above questions from the main focus of the present study which it has endeavoured to answer on the basis of information collected under a survey, from the teaching fraternity, in the University of Poona and its affiliated colleges.

There is hardly any study which evaluates the operation of the ADA-based UEW scheme, in such a comprehensive manner. The present study greatly fulfills the vacuum.

Title: Advances in Plant Physiology
Author: কানান
Summary:
If one may recall nearly half a century ago, there wre small books, Methuen series publishing on special subjects like photosynthesis (C.P. Whittingham) and Plant Respiration (W.Stiles) in the 1950s and have been of great guidance for post-graduate studies in those years. Now great breakthrough have been made with the introduction of isotopes, modern tools and instruments which can project into the cell components and unravel the 'secrets' of plant life, with the results no one book could so completely cover a single topic like photosynthesis or respiration.

Contents : 
Preface
Plant Physilogy has became Plant Biology: "A Cross- Disciplinary Science"
Carbon
Dioxide
Flowering
Plant Hormones
Water Transport in Rice
Salt Tolerance
Nutrient Uptake and Transport
Water Saving Agriculture
Crop Biotechnology
Genetically Modified Plants
Plants and Population
Epilogue
Bibliography
Anenxure
Index

Title: Teaching of Life Science
Author: এস. পি. শর্মা
Summary: The Physical Sciences group includes those branches of Science which are related with the Study of non-living material such as Physics and chemistry. In the life science group principles of sciences. One does not need the specialized and deep Knowledge as advocated and contained in the specialized branches of science. Therefore for most of us general science can serve the Purpose well by being science of everyday use and also by being essentially Elementary and simple in comprehension. Science helps us to utilize our leisure purposefully. In addition it makes our lives happy by providing Scientific gadgets for our entertainment in our spare time. Under the former scheme gifted Children in science are provided with a different set of science curriculum quite enriched and advanced in quantity as well as quality as compared with the common curriculum designed for all the students studying physical and life sciences. Text Books occupy a central and prominent place in any scheme of teaching-learning process related to the study of any subject or branches of knowledge. It is why the textbooks are considered quite indispensable at all stages of science education. It can be said beyond doubt that the scientific excursions or trips when organised in systematic and proper way prove quite effective and useful from the point of view of the realization of the aims and objectives of Teaching science. This book contains twenty five chapters including the new trends and Experiments in science teaching, Professional growth of the science and the life History and scientific contribution of Dr. Khurana. It also includes the chapter on evaluation in science teaching.
